ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Initial GCS (1st available Glasgow Coma Scale Score)
Notes: for an mTBI, GCS must be between 13 and 15

ElementDescription: Brain Imaging upon admission (Head CT or Brain MRI)
Notes: 1=Negative (no acute intracranial findings); 2=Positive (acute intracranial findings); 3=Not performed/Unknown

ElementDescription: Retrograde Amnesia (RGA) "Tell me what happened right before [the accident, your fall, the injury]" If unclear: "Was there anything or any period of time right before you were hurt that you don't remember?" *RGA must be present RIGHT before injury and can extend backward in time for any duration
RGA, hours?
RGA, minutes?
RGA Total Minutes

Loss of consciousness (LOC) "Were you knocked out? Did you lose consciousness?" If witnessed per EPIC OR subject report, select Witnessed, if subject believes LOC was present but was alone/unwitnessed, select Suspected.
LOC, minutes?
LOC, seconds?
LOC Total Seconds

Post-traumatic amnesia (PTA) "Is there anything you don't remember after [the accident, your fall, you were injured]?" [If memory is fuzzy/came in and out:] "When did your memory become continuous?" For +LOC: full memory afer waking - no PTA; if some PTA after waking, record duration as time from injury to clearing of PTA -If unwitnessed period of time with no memory - record as unwitnessed LOC or unwitnessed PTA but not both, based on subject belief of their state
PTA, hours?
PTA, minutes?
PTA Total Minutes

Head trauma or acceleration / deceleration event "Did our head or face hit anything / Were you hit in the head or face?" If no head trauma and MVC or similar mechanism: "Was your head suddenly jolted?" *If ANY contact with head/face, select Struck by/Against instead of other options.
Notes: 0= None; 1= Struck by/against (contact with head /face); 2= Whiplash (forceful jolt to head without contact)

ElementDescription: Altered Mental Status (AMS) self-report READ VERBATIM: "Right after you [were injured/woke up], did you feel confused, dazed, stunned, see stars or like you got your bell rung?
If yes, check what was endorssed by subject:
Symptoms "Right after the accident or soon after, tell me if you had any of these symptoms."
Notes: 1= Headache; 2=Nausea; 3= Vomiting; 4=Dizziness; 5= Fatigue; 6= Difficulty Sleeping; 7= Drowsiness; 8= Sensitivity to Light; 9= Sensitivity to Noise; 10= Blurred Vision; 11= Memory Difficulties; 12= Difficulty Concentrating; 13= Balance Problems

ElementDescription: Altered Mental Status - Other Was any information gathered elsewhere in the interview that could suggest acute mental status changes/AMS?
Symptoms. If Other, list:

Participant Group: Subject meets criteria for all mTBI if ALL of the following are present: (1) Struck by/against or whiplash event (2) Altered mental status (reported OR LOC < 30 minutes OR PTA < 24 hours) (3) One or more subjective symptoms (4) Initial Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) = 13-15 Participant is eligible for which group?
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
